alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Boyd, south central Lawrence, west central Cabell and northwestern Wayne Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 529 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ceredo, or near Chesapeake, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Ashland, Chesapeake, Kenova, Catlettsburg, Ceredo, South Point, Burlington, Lockwood, and Lavalette. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 189 and 191. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
